recipe_title: Deluxe Redeye Gravy with Pork Shoulder Picnic
original_instructions:
1. Cook pork in large skillet according to package directions. Remove pork from skillet, reserving pan drippings in skillet; cover pork to keep warm.
2. Add onions and bell peppers to drippings in skillet; cook and stir over medium heat 4 minutes, or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add flour; cook and stir 2 minutes.
3. Gradually add coffee and water; stirring until blended. Simmer 6 minutes, or until gravy is thickened, stirring frequently.
4. Add milk, salt and pepper; mix well. Cook 6 minutes, or until heated through, stirring occasionally.
5. Serve gravy spooned over pork slices.
ingredients: 1 Cook's Bone-in Super Trim Pork Shoulder Half Picnic (2 pounds), cut into 1/4-inch -thick slices
1/4 cup finely chopped green bell pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Cook pork in a large skillet according to package directions.
Remove pork from the skillet, reserving pan drippings in the skillet; cover pork to keep warm.
Add onions and bell peppers to drippings in skillet; cook and stir over medium heat for 4 minutes, or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Add flour; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Gradually add coffee and water; stirring until blended.
Simmer for 6 minutes, or until gravy is thickened, stirring frequently.
Add milk, salt, and pepper; mix well.
Cook for 6 minutes, or until heated through, stirring occasionally.
Serve gravy spooned over pork slices.

original_instructions:
Place the potatoes in a stockpot and cover with cold water; add the rosemary and garlic. Bring to a simmer and cook until the potatoes are al dente, about 30 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the water and let cool.
Preheat a deep-fryer filled with vegetable oil to 350 degrees F.
Cut the potatoes into bite-size pieces and fry them in the oil until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels, then transfer to a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Place the potatoes in a stockpot and cover with cold water.
Add the rosemary and garlic to the pot.
Bring to a simmer and cook until the potatoes are al dente, about 30 minutes.
Remove the potatoes from the water and let cool.
Preheat a deep-fryer filled with vegetable oil to 350 degrees F.
Cut the potatoes into bite-size pieces.
Fry the cut potatoes in the oil until golden brown and crispy.
Drain the fried potatoes on paper towels.
Transfer the drained potatoes to a bowl.
Season the potatoes with salt and pepper.

original_instructions:
Slice the eggplant on the diagonal into 1/4-inch thick slices. Add to a hot grill pan and grill until slices are marked on both sides and the eggplant is tender, about 7 minutes on each side. Season with salt and pepper, remove from grill pan and set aside.
In a bowl, combine the ginger, garlic, olives, tomatoes, scallions, sesame seeds, zest and rice vinegar.
Arrange the eggplant on two plates, top with the vegetable mixture, sprinkle more sesame seeds on top

step_by_step_instructions: Slice the eggplant on the diagonal into 1/4-inch thick slices.
Add to a hot grill pan and grill until slices are marked on both sides and the eggplant is tender, about 7 minutes on each side.
Season with salt and pepper, remove from grill pan and set aside.
In a bowl, combine the ginger, garlic, olives, tomatoes, scallions, sesame seeds, lemon zest and rice vinegar.
Arrange the eggplant on two plates.
Top with the vegetable mixture.
Sprinkle more sesame seeds on top.

original_instructions: In a small bowl, combine the vinegar, mayonnaise, poppy seeds, celery salt, cilantro and hot sauce, stirring until well blended. In a medium bowl, toss together the cabbage, carrots, green onions, bell pepper and jicama. Pour dressing over cabbage mixture and toss until vegetables are coated with dressing. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour so that flavors meld. Serve chilled.
ingredients: 1/2 cup thinly sliced green onions (about 4 green onions)
1 medium red bell pepper, thinly sliced
1 cup finely julienned jicama, (1 jicama, about the size of a softball)

step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, combine vinegar, mayonnaise, poppy seeds, celery salt, cilantro, and hot sauce. Stir until well blended.
In a medium bowl, toss together cabbage, carrots, green onions, bell pepper, and jicama.
Pour dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss until vegetables are coated with dressing.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour so that flavors meld.
Serve chilled.

original_instructions:
Put the clam juice in a medium microwave-safe bowl and microwave until very hot, about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, scatter the potatoes, carrots, celery, onion and garlic in a 6-quart slow cooker. Tie the dill, parsley, thyme, bay leaves and lemon zest together with twine and add to the slow cooker. Pour in the hot clam juice; cover and cook on high, 3 1/2 hours.
Season the salmon with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Stir the heavy cream into the vegetables in the slow cooker, then partially submerge the salmon in the liquid. Cover and cook 30 more minutes.
Discard the herb bundle; season the chowder with salt and pepper. Serve topped with chives and dill.
Photograph by Christopher Testani
ingredients: 3 cups bottled clam juice or low-sodium chicken broth
12 sprigs dill, plus chopped leaves for topping
1 pound salmon fillet (preferably wild), skin removed, cut into 4 pieces
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Put the clam juice in a medium microwave-safe bowl and microwave until very hot, about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, scatter the potatoes, carrots, celery, onion and garlic in a 6-quart slow cooker.
Tie the dill, parsley, thyme, bay leaves, and lemon zest together with twine and add to the slow cooker.
Pour in the hot clam juice; cover and cook on high for 3 1/2 hours.
Season the salmon with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.
Stir the heavy cream into the vegetables in the slow cooker, then partially submerge the salmon in the liquid.
Cover and cook for 30 more minutes.
Discard the herb bundle; season the chowder with salt and pepper.
Serve topped with chives and dill.

recipe_title: Chorizo Sliders with Spicy Avocado Spread
original_instructions:
Special equipment: Food Processor
Combine the pork, chorizo, cumin, paprika, salt, garlic and onions together in a large mixing bowl. Form the mixture into twelve 2-ounce patties and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to grill.
Preheat a grill over medium-high heat.
Grill the patties until the meat is cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes per side. In the last couple of minutes of grilling, top with the manchego cheese and cover the grill to help the cheese melt.
Spread the Spicy Avocado Spread on both halves of all the rolls. Place the sliders on the bottom halves, then top with the lettuce and the top halves of the rolls.
Scoop the avocado flesh into a food processor. Add the sour cream, salt, coriander, chili powder, cayenne and lime juice and pulse until smooth. Taste and adjust the seasoning with more salt if necessary.
ingredients: 8 ounces fresh (raw) chorizo, removed from casing
8 ounces manchego cheese, cut into slices
1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more if needed

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the ground pork, chorizo, cumin, paprika, salt, minced garlic, and diced onions in a large mixing bowl.
Form the mixture into twelve 2-ounce patties.
Place the patties on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Cover the patties with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to grill.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the patties until the meat is cooked through, about 3 to 4 minutes per side.
In the last couple of minutes of grilling, top the patties with manchego cheese slices and cover the grill to melt the cheese.
Cut the avocados and scoop the flesh into a food processor.
Add sour cream, salt, coriander, chili powder, cayenne, and lime juice to the food processor.
Pulse the mixture until smooth and adjust the seasoning with more salt if necessary.
Spread the Spicy Avocado Spread on both halves of each roll.
Place the grilled patties on the bottom halves of the rolls.
Top each patty with a piece of lettuce and the top half of the roll.

original_instructions: In a small saucepan over medium heat, add the butter and chives. Saute until the butter is fragrant, about 30 seconds. Remove from the heat and add the truffle oil and season with salt and pepper. Place the popcorn into a large bowl and pour over the truffled butter and sprinkle in the Parmesan. Toss well to combine and serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons black truffle salt or oil
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 bag microwave popcorn, popped as directed

step_by_step_instructions: In a small saucepan over medium heat, add the butter and chives.
Saute until the butter is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Remove from the heat and add the truffle oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place the popcorn into a large bowl.
Pour over the truffled butter and sprinkle in the Parmesan.
Toss well to combine and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat a grill pan over medium heat.
In a large pot over medium heat, stir together the lager, chili sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, curry powder and hot sauce. Cook until reduced by half, 3 to 5 minutes.
While the sauce is reducing, grill the sausages on the grill pan until browned and cooked through, turning every so often, about 12 minutes. Set aside.
Brush the onions with olive oil, season with salt and pepper and grill on the same pan you grilled the sausages. Cook until brown and golden, about 10 minutes.
Put the grilled sausages in the pot with the sauce, then add the onions. Cook together for 1 to 2 minutes.
Serve the sausages on crusty rolls topped with the onions and lots of sauce.
ingredients: 1 cup chili sauce, such as Heinz
Pinch of freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a grill pan over medium heat.
In a large pot over medium heat, combine lager, chili sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, curry powder, and hot sauce.
Cook the mixture until it reduces by half, approximately 3 to 5 minutes.
While the sauce is reducing, grill the sausages on the grill pan until browned and cooked through, around 12 minutes, turning occasionally.
Set the sausages aside.
Brush onions with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and grill on the same pan.
Cook onions until brown and golden, approximately 10 minutes.
Place the grilled sausages into the pot with the reduced sauce and add the grilled onions.
Cook everything together for 1 to 2 minutes.
Serve the sausages on crusty rolls topped with the onions and sauce.

original_instructions: In a small bowl or 2-cup measuring cup, beat the egg until foamy. Add buttermilk and vanilla and blend well. Add the baking soda, one teaspoonful at a time, sprinkling it in and beating until the mixture is smooth and the consistency of light cream. Add the lemon juice all at once and blend into the mixture. Stir, do not beat (you want it creamy but without a lot of air). The mixture will congeal into a pasty lump. Scoop it out of the bowl using a spatula and spread it on a floured surface. Sift the flour and 3/4 cup sugar together and use the fingertips to work it into the egg-lemon mixture. With a floured rolling pin, roll the dough out 1/32 inches thick, and with the tip of a sharp knife, cut the 'angel' shapes and twist up the edges to form a shell-like curve about 3/8 inch high. Sprinkle on the remainder of the sugar. Brush each angel with melted butter. Place angels one inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet and bake for 12 minutes or until golden.;
ingredients: 1/2 cup buttermilk (or 1/4 cup milk mixed with 1/4 cup vinegar)

step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl or 2-cup measuring cup, beat the egg until foamy.
Add buttermilk and vanilla and blend well.
Add the baking soda, one teaspoonful at a time, sprinkling it in and beating until the mixture is smooth and the consistency of light cream.
Add the lemon juice all at once and blend into the mixture.
Stir the mixture to make it creamy without adding too much air.
Scoop the mixture out of the bowl using a spatula and spread it on a floured surface.
Sift the flour and 3/4 cup sugar together and work it into the egg-lemon mixture with your fingertips.
With a floured rolling pin, roll the dough out to 1/32 inches thick.
Cut 'angel' shapes with the tip of a sharp knife and twist up the edges to form a shell-like curve about 3/8 inch high.
Sprinkle on the remainder of the sugar.
Brush each 'angel' with melted butter.
Place angels one inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake for 12 minutes or until golden.

recipe_title: Chicken Alfredo with Mushrooms and Asparagus
original_instructions:
Heat oil in large, heavy skillet over moderate heat 2 minutes. Add mushrooms, onion, garlic, marjoram, thyme, and pepper and cook, stirring often, until the juice released from the mushrooms evaporates, about 5 minutes.
Add chicken, alfredo sauce, and wine; adjust heat so mixture bubbles gently, then cook, stirring frequently and breaking up chicken, until steaming, about 3 minutes.
Add asparagus, distributing evenly over surface of mixture, cover and cook just until crisp-tender, 2 to 3 minutes; no longer or asparagus will become mushy.
Make a bed of rice on heated deep platter, spoon chicken mixture on top, and serve.
Bring water to rapid boil in large (at least 4 1/2-quart), heavy saucepan over high heat.
Add rice, stir well, and then return to rapid boil. Adjust heat so water stays at gentle but steady ripple and cook uncovered until all water is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Do not stir.
Fluff rice gently with fork and cool 1 hour. Do not cover.
Fluff rice gently again, then spoon lightly, do not pack, into plastic storage containers, snap on lids, label, and date. Set in refrigerator or freezer.
To reheat refrigerated or frozen rice, pile rice in large fine sieve, fork lightly apart and balance sieve in top of large, heavy saucepan over 2-inches boiling water. Cover loosely with lid or foil and steam until just heated through, 3 to 5 minutes, but times will vary according to amount of rice being reheated and whether it's refrigerated or frozen. Fluff with fork and serve.
Yield: 16 cups
ingredients: 1 cup fresh or frozen chopped onion (about 1 medium-large yellow onion)
1 (10-ounce) package carved, fully cooked chicken breast
1 (10-ounce) package prepared alfredo sauce (from the refrigerator counter; use light or reduced-fat, if you like)
1/4 cup dry Marsala, Sherry, or white wine
1 (9-ounce) package frozen asparagus cuts (do not thaw but do separate into individual pieces)
3 cups Al Dente Make-Ahead Rice, reheated, recipe follows
4 cups uncooked converted white rice (no substitute)

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oil in a large, heavy skillet over moderate heat for 2 minutes.
Add mushrooms, onion, garlic, marjoram, thyme, and pepper; cook, stirring often, until mushroom juice evaporates, about 5 minutes.
Add chicken, alfredo sauce, and wine; adjust heat so mixture bubbles gently, then cook, stirring frequently and breaking up chicken, until steaming, about 3 minutes.
Add asparagus evenly over the surface, cover and cook until crisp-tender, 2 to 3 minutes.
Make a bed of rice on a heated deep platter, spoon chicken mixture on top, and serve.
Bring water to a rapid boil in a large, heavy saucepan over high heat.
Add rice, stir, return to a rapid boil, adjust heat to maintain a gentle ripple, and cook uncovered until water is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Do not stir.
Fluff rice gently with a fork and cool for 1 hour without covering.
Fluff rice again, then spoon lightly into storage containers and refrigerate or freeze.
To reheat rice, pile in a sieve, fork apart, balance over boiling water, cover loosely, and steam until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.
